sen.j: 大山崎駅（おおやまざきえき）は、京都府乙訓郡大山崎町にある、阪急電鉄阪急京都本線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Oyamazaki-cho, Otokuni-gun, Kyoto Prefecture, Oyamazaki Station is a stop on the Hankyu Kyoto Line, which is operated by the Hankyu Railway.
Oyamazaki Station, located in Oyamazaki-cho, Otokuni-gun, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Hankyu Kyoto Line, which is operated by the Hankyu Railway.
Oyamazaki Station, located in Oyamazaki-cho, Otokuni-gun, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Hankyu Kyoto Line, which is operated by the Hankyu Railway.

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のホームを持つ高架駅。
sen.e: Oyamazaki Station is an elevated station having two separate platforms serving two tracks.
Oyamazaki Station is an elevated station having two separate platforms serving two tracks.
Oyamazaki Station is an elevated station having two separate platforms serving two tracks.

sen.j: 改札口は地平にあり、京都府道・大阪府道67号西京高槻線（西国街道）に面する1ヶ所のみ。

sen.j: JR京都線 山崎駅 (京都府)へは、直線距離で180m程。
sen.e: The linear distance from Oyamazaki Station to the JR Kyoto Line Yamazaki Station (Kyoto Prefecture) is about 180 m.
The linear distance from Oyamazaki Station to the JR Kyoto Line Yamazaki Station (Kyoto Prefecture) is approximately 180 meters.
The linear distance from Oyamazaki Station to the JR Kyoto Line Yamazaki Station (Kyoto Prefecture) is approximately 180 meters.

sen.j: 東海道新幹線と併走している。
sen.e: Oyamazaki Station is along the Tokaido Shinkansen.
Oyamazaki Station is along the Tokaido Shinkansen.
Oyamazaki Station is along the Tokaido Shinkansen.

sen.j: 最寄り停留所は、京都府道・大阪府道67号西京高槻線上にある阪急大山崎となる。
sen.e: The nearest bus stop is Hankyu Oyamazaki which is located on the Kyoto and Osaka prefectural road No.67 Nishikyo Takatsuki Route.
The nearest bus stop is Hankyu Oyamazaki, which is located on the Kyoto and Osaka Prefectural Road No. 67, Nishikyo Takatsuki Route.
The nearest bus stop is Hankyu Oyamazaki, which is located on the Nishikyo Takatsuki Line of the Kyoto and Osaka Prefectural Route 67.

sen.j: 以下の路線が乗り入れ、阪急バス、京阪バスにより運行されている。
sen.e: Hankyu Bus Co.,Ltd. and Keihan Bus Co.,Ltd. operate the following bus routes.
Hankyu Bus Co., Ltd., and Keihan Bus Co., Ltd., operate the following bus routes:
Hankyu Bus Co., Ltd., and Keihan Bus Co., Ltd., operate the following bus routes:

sen.j: また、中央競馬開催日には、山崎駅前から京都競馬場への臨時バスが、年始には八幡市駅までの臨時バスが運行される。
sen.e: From Yamazaki Station, special buses for Kyoto Race Course are operated on the days of horse-racing, and special buses for Yawatashi Station are operated during the New Year holidays.
From Yamazaki Station, special buses for Kyoto Race Course are operated on the days of horse racing, and special buses for Yawatashi Station are operated during the New Year holidays.
From Yamazaki Station, special buses for Kyoto Race Course are operated on the days of horse racing, and special buses for Yawatashi Station are operated during the New Year holidays.

sen.j: 18系統：山崎駅 (京都府)行、長岡京駅行（阪急）

Route 18: Bound for Yamazaki Station (Kyoto Prefecture) and Nagaokakyo Station (Hankyu)

sen.j: 13号経路：淀駅行（京阪）
平成15年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約3,255人（京都府統計書より）。
sen.e: The number of passengers per day was about 3,255 in 2003 (adapted from Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Book).
The number of passengers per day was about 3,255 in 2003 (according to the Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Book).
The number of passengers per day was about 3,255 in fiscal year 2003 (according to the Kyoto Prefecture Statistics Report).
sen.cmt: 統一しました。fiscal →fiscal yearに変更しました。

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）11月1日 新京阪鉄道高槻町～京都西院開通時に開業。
sen.e: On November 1, 1928 Oyamazaki Station was opened when the section between Takatsuki-cho Station and Kyoto Saiin Station of the Shinkeihan Railway was opened.
November 1, 1928: Oyamazaki Station was opened when the section between Takatsuki-cho Station and Kyoto Saiin Station of the Shinkeihan Railway was opened.
November 1, 1928: Oyamazaki Station was opened when the section between Takatsuki-cho Station and Kyoto Saiin Station of the Shinkeihan Railway was opened.

sen.j: 1930年（昭和5年）9月15日 会社合併により京阪電気鉄道新京阪線の駅となる。
sen.e: On September 15, 1930 Oyamazaki Station became a stop on the Shinkeihan Line operated by the Keihan Electric Railway as a result of amalgamation.
September 15, 1930: Oyamazaki Station became a stop on the Shinkeihan Line, operated by the Keihan Electric Railway, as a result of amalgamation.
September 15, 1930: Oyamazaki Station became a stop on the Shinkeihan Line, operated by the Keihan Electric Railway, as a result of amalgamation.

sen.j: 1943年（昭和18年）10月1日 会社合併により京阪神急行電鉄（現在の阪急電鉄）の駅となる。
sen.e: On October 1, 1943 Oyamazaki Station came to be operated by the Keihanshin Express Railway (the current Hankyu Railway) as a result of amalgamation.
October 1, 1943: Oyamazaki Station came to be operated by the Keihanshin Express Railway (the current Hankyu Railway) as a result of amalgamation.
October 1, 1943: Oyamazaki Station came to be operated by the Keihanshin Express Railway (the current Hankyu Railway) as a result of amalgamation.

sen.j: 1963年（昭和38年）4月24日 高架化工事のため東海道新幹線の線路を借用し、仮設ホームを置いて営業。
sen.e: On April 24, 1963 Oyamazaki Station was operated with temporary platforms, using tracks of Tokaido Shinkansen during the elevation construction.
April 24, 1963: Oyamazaki Station was operated with temporary platforms, using the tracks of Tokaido Shinkansen during the elevation construction.
April 24, 1963: Oyamazaki Station was operated with temporary platforms, using the tracks of Tokaido Shinkansen during the elevation construction.

sen.j: 1963年（昭和38年）12月29日 高架線竣工。
sen.e: Elevated tracks were completed on December 29, 1963.
December 29, 1963: The elevated tracks were completed.
December 29, 1963: The elevated tracks were completed.

sen.j: 現ホームに移設。
sen.e: The platforms were transferred to the current location.
The platforms were transferred to their current location.
The platforms were transferred to their current location.

sen.j: 水無瀬駅 - 大山崎駅 - 長岡天神駅

Minase Station - Oyamazaki Station - Nagaokatenjin Station

sen.j: ※大山崎駅～長岡天神駅間の、京都第二外環状道路（計画中）との交差地点に新駅を設置することで、長岡京市と阪急電鉄が合意した。
sen.e: ※Nagaokakyo City and Hankyu Railway agreed to build a new station on the intersection of Kyoto Second Outer Ring Road (under contemplation) and the section between Oyamazaki Station and Nagaokatenjin Station.

※Nagaokakyo City and Hankyu Railway agreed to build a new station at the intersection of the Kyoto Second Outer Ring Road (under contemplation) and the section between Oyamazaki Station and Nagaokatenjin Station.

Nagaokakyo City and Hankyu Railway agreed to build a new station at the intersection of the Kyoto Second Outer Ring Road (under contemplation) and the section between Oyamazaki Station and Nagaokatenjin Station.

sen.j: 但し、着工、開業時期などは未定。
sen.e: It has not been decided when the construction begins or when the new station opens.
It has not been decided when the construction will begin or when the new station will open.
